segments.text: I see the water just pouring over the edge of the sink, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and the woman is just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the way the water is streaming down the cabinets, ruining everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is still running, and the drain isn’t working at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to be flooded if someone doesn’t turn it off soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s foot is already wet, but she doesn’t even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the dishes stacked next to her, like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just spreading everywhere, and she’s completely ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even notice until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she’s holding that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around before the whole kitchen is ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR
